validationRules.title1: Required, label for first switch option
validationRules.title2: Required, label for second switch option
validationRules.blockTemp1: Required when source1='template', must be valid template slug
validationRules.blockTemp2: Required when source2='template', must be valid template slug
validationRules.carouselId: Optional, must match block_id of existing tp-carousel block
validationRules.innerBlocks: Must contain exactly 2 tp-switch-inner child blocks

warnings: Always add exactly 2 tp-switch-inner child blocks (one for each switch state)
switchStyle determines which styling attributes are applicable (check style conditions)
Template mode (source='template') requires valid template slugs from Saved Templates
carouselId integration only works with tp-carousel blocks on the same page
lblIcon requires switch1Icn and switch2Icn to be set with valid icon class names
style-3 uses lineColor, lineOffset, lineHeight (not switchColor/swichBgcolor)
style-4 uses switchWidth and wrapRadius (not available for other styles)
labSpacebet only applies to style-1 and style-2
toggleSize only applies to style-1 and style-2
Don't set switchColor/swichBgcolor for style-3 (underline only)
Always set openTypography: 1 before setting typography values
commonMistakes: Forgetting to add tp-switch-inner child blocks (switcher won't display content)
Setting blockTemp1/blockTemp2 but leaving source as 'content'
Using template slugs that don't exist in WordPress
Mixing style-specific attributes (e.g., lineColor with style-1)
Not setting carouselId correctly (must match exact block_id)
Forgetting to set lblIcon: true when adding icons
Using invalid icon class names for switch1Icn/switch2Icn
Setting responsive values without unit property
Forgetting showBtn: false when you want to hide the toggle (edge case)
Setting typography attributes without openTypography: 1 first
Adding more or less than 2 tp-switch-inner blocks
bestPractices: Use style-1 or style-2 for pricing/plan comparisons
Use style-3 for modern, minimalist designs
Add icons (lblIcon: true) for visual clarity and better UX
Use template mode for complex, reusable content layouts
Set responsive font sizes (md/sm/xs) for better mobile experience
Apply box shadows (switchBshadow) for depth and visual hierarchy
Use contrasting colors for active/inactive states
Set ActlabelColor and ActswichBgcolor to match brand colors
Test toggle transitions on all devices
Use carouselId integration for before/after image comparisons
Keep label text concise (1-2 words) for better mobile display
Set appropriate labSpacebet to prevent label/toggle overlap

childRequirements: First child = content for switch state 1
Second child = content for switch state 2
Each child can contain any other Nexter blocks
Child blocks are hidden/shown based on toggle state
parentControls: Parent determines content source (content vs template)
Children (tp-switch-inner) only contain the actual content

accessibilityNotes: Switcher is keyboard accessible (Tab to focus, Space/Enter to toggle)
Active state is visually distinct (ActlabelColor, ActswichBgcolor)
Use meaningful label text for screen readers
Ensure color contrast meets WCAG AA standards (4.5:1 minimum)
Icons should supplement text labels, not replace them
Touch target size should be at least 44x44px on mobile
Avoid using color alone to indicate state (use icons or text)
